If you’re tasked with generating 10,000 data points that conform to this distribution, what would be your approach? Here are the two most commonly used methods to sample data from an arbitrary probability density function: Inverse Transform Sampling Rejection Sampling Inverse Transform Sampling involves generating data points by calculating the cumulative distribution function (CDF) of the probability density function, deriving its inverse function, and then using this inverse function to produce data points.
